questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You are tasked with creating a network that will accomplish the following requirements
Requirements:
1. The remote sales team must be able to connect to the corporate network
2. Each department must have ONLY two PCs and a server
3. Each department must be segmented from each other
4. The following VLANs have been designated:
a ) VLAN 2- Finance
b ) VLAN 12- Sales
c ) VLAN 22- Human Resources (HR)
Complete the network by dragging the required objects into the diagram
INSTRUCTIONS: Objects can be used multiple times and not all placeholders need to be filled
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content: This just looks way off. As I see it, the sales server should be with the sales pcs on the left. The sales server should be a layer 2 switch. The layer 3 switch should be a router. The layer 2 switch should be a layer 3 switch so the Vlans there can interVLAN route. Why would the sales pcs go straight to the server?

comments.content: The answer is correct, layer 3 switch = layer 2 switch + router.

questions.question_text:
A company utilizes a patching server to regularly update their PC's. After the latest round of patching all of the older PCs with non-gigabit Ethernet cards become disconnected from the network and now require a technician to fix the issue locally at each PC.
Which of the following should be done to prevent this issue in the future?

choices.A: Enable automatic rebooting of the PCs after patching is completed
choices.B: Require the patching server to update the oldest PCs off hours
choices.C: Disable automatic driver updates to PCs on the patching server
choices.D: Throttle the connection speed of the patching server to match older PCs

discussion.content: In my opinion on described scenario, I dont think there is an option to customize patching server to certain servers only. Disbaling patching server will affect all other servers.
why the answer is D not C

Kudos to exam topics for such a rich and wealthy content, it would have been nice to see explanations provided under the answers to help users(students) in understanding the concepts within the question(s).

questions.question_text: Which of the following protocols is used to encapsulate other network layer protocols such as multicast and IPX over WAN connections?

A network technician needs to connect two switches. The technician needs a link between them which is capable of handling 10gb.
Which of the following media would be optimal for this application?

comments.content: "Optimal" Cat6e maxes at 10gb so it is not optimal, since it would basically stressing out the cables.

discussion.content:
Granted, C maybe the best option, but technically CAT6 cables can also handle 10Gbps throughput (Note: CAT6 can do so with up to a limitation of 55 meters, a limitation not present in CAT6e).

However, the question / answers are misleading without additional information (such as availability, budget, distance between switches etc.), without which having two possible correct answers C and D is bad form; it needs to be more clear cut, or have the the question be more descriptive (eliminating either the Optical option (budget) or CAT6 (distance)).

CAT3 vs. CAT5 vs. CAT5e vs. CAT6 vs. CAT6e vs. CAT6a vs. CAT7
https://customcable.ca/cat5-vs-cat6/

Why is speed being set to "auto?" The question explicitly says "the access points should be configured to ONLY support TKIP (AES) clients at a MAXIMUM speed. Setting to auto allows devices to connect at lower speeds. Any explanation?

questions.question_text:
SIMULATION -
You have been tasked with setting up a wireless network in an office. The network will consist of 3 access points and a single switch. The network must meet the following parameters.
The SSIDs need to be configured as corpnet with a key of S3cr3t!
The wireless signals should not interfere with each other
The subnet the Access points and Switch are on should only support 30 devices maximum
The access Points should be configured to only support TKIP clients at a maximum speed
Instructions: Click on the devices to review their information and adjust the setting of the APs to meet the given requirements.
//IMG//
questions.answer_description:
This simulation is still under construction. On the first exhibit, the layout should be as follows

Access Point Name AP1 -

IP Address 192.168.1.3 -

Gateway 192.168.1.2 -

SSID corpnet -

SSID Broadcast yes -

Mode G -

Channel 1 -

Speed Auto -

Duplex Auto -

WPA -
Passphrase S3cr3t!

Exhibit 2 as follows -

Access Point Name AP2 -

IP Address 192.168.1.4 -

Gateway 192.168.1.2 -

SSID corpnet -

SSID Broadcast yes -

Mode G -

Channel 6 -

Speed Auto -

Duplex Auto -

WPA -
Passphrase S3cr3t!

Exhibit 3 as follows -

Access Point Name AP3 -

IP Address 192.168.1.5 -

Gateway 192.168.1.2 -

SSID corpnet -

SSID Broadcast yes -

Mode G -

Channel 11 -

Speed Auto -

Duplex Auto -

WPA -
